snippet: Nearly 5,000 children qualified for gifted and talented kindergarten seats in New York City public schools in the fall, 22 percent more than last year and more than double the number four years ago.
abstract: Nearly 5,000 children qualified for gifted and talented kindergarten seats in New York City public schools, a 22 percent increase from 2010, setting off a fierce competition for the most sought-after programs; experts point to a larger number of middle-class and wealthy parents who are choosing to raise their children in the city and send them to public schools, along with the switch to a test-based admissions system that has given rise to test-preparation services that can cost several hundred dollars or more.
lead_paragraph: Nearly 5,000 children qualified for gifted and talented kindergarten seats in New York City public schools in the fall, 22 percent more than last year and more than double the number four years ago.

headline.seo: As Ranks of Gifted Soar in N.Y., Fight Brews for Kindergarten Slots
headline.main: After Number of Gifted Soars, a Fight for Kindergarten Slots
headline.print_headline: After Number of Gifted Soars, A Fight for Kindergarten Slots
